src:
Utisci sa ostrva: Zvezdi fali završnica, Ndombele vodio šou program, Lo Selso proradio, Sonu većina naslova
Šta piše engleska štampa
07 Nov 2019 by Dejan Stanković
Emotivan trenutak Hjong-min Sona, koji je i prvi gol protiv Crvene zvezde iskoristio za izvinjenje Andreu Gomesu, poslužio je većini ostrvskih medija kao naslovni detalj sa uverljivih 4:0 Totenhema u Beogradu. Međutim, kad govorimo o samoj slici na terenu većina je pri izboru za najboljeg igrača utakmica imala dilemu: Tangi Ndombele ili Đovani lo Selso?
Posebno prijatna debata za navijače, jer Totenhemova letnja pojačanja nisu bila previše impresivna na početku londonske avanture, ali su na stadionu “Rajko Mitić“ nagovestili da bi kad se podvuče crta mogli da se isplate. Čak je i Rajan Sesenjon, koji je u meč ušao tek u završnici, asistirao Kristijanu Eriksenu za četvrti gol.
Ali Ndombele i Lo Selso su bili zvezde večeri, pa tako londonski Ivning Standard piše...“Bila je ovo utakmica Sparsa puna pozitivnih utisaka, ali nijedan nije bio veći od Ndombelea, koji je vodio šou program. Puno klasnih okreta, dodira i kreacije, ali njegov najbolji momenat je viđen u izgradnji Sonovog prvog gola, kada se Francuz stuštio između dvojice čuvara i pod pritiskom odigrao savršen pas sa Alija. Jednako ohrabrujuće poput njegove partije je bila i činjenica da je odigrao svih 90 minuta tokom kojih nije bledeo kao u nekim ranijim mečevima, recimo u onih 2:7 protiv Bajerna... S obzirom na cenu od 60.000.000 evra nije iznenađenje što je Ndombele pristojan igrač, ali ova večerašnja partija je signal da bi Totenhem pre nego kasnije mogao da gradi tim oko njega“.
Isti list navodi i da nije sve bilo idealno i da se činilo da bi Zvezda pored potpuno nove defanzivne četvorke Totenhema mogla da postigne gol svaki put kad bi došla do poslednje trećine terena što se ipak “nije dešavalo previše često“. Govori to nešto i o domininaciji gostujućeg tima na sredini terena.



I Gardijan primećuje da je Zvezda imala nekoliko izvanrednih šansi, ali da je Totenhem prosto kvalitetniji sastav. Držao je loptu, imao 17 šuteva naspram pet Zvezdini i na kraju zasluženo pobedio. Za razliku od Standarda ugledni Gardijan piše da je Lo Selso zaslužio najviše komplimenata, mada i ovaj prvi list piše da je Argentinac bio “ostrvo mira u inače ludom meču“. Lo Selsa je i Independent proglasio za igrača utakmice ističući u prvi plan njegov gol koji je otvorio Zvezdu.“Pozajmljeni igrač iz Betisa koga Totenhem može da na leto otkupi za 60.000.000 evra, prethodno je odigrao samo 74 minuta za Sparse. Posle 6. jula i njegove poslednje utakmice sa Argentinom na Kopa Americi čekao je 8. avgust i poslednji dan prelaznog roka u Engleskoj da potpiše. Propustio je kompletne pripreme, mučio se sa spremom. Ali je igrajući po desnoj strani pokazao koliko može da doprinese promenom tempa i željom da prosledi direktan pas“, piše Gardijan.
Komentarišući Zvezdine promašene šanse, Gardijan dodaje i da je crveno-belima “nedostajao završni proizod“.
Za kraj i ocene, samo su se dve novine bavile i Beograđanima i očekivano nisu bile previše velikodušne. Dejli Mejl im je svima “zalepio“ petice, Independent je podelio i neku šesticu. Što se tiče Totenhema, najgore je prošao Davinson Sančez, najbolje baš Ndombele, koji je zaradio i poneku “devetku“, kao uostalom i logičan izbor, dvostruki strelac Son za koga svi pišu da je izašao iz psihičke krize nakon što je na utakmici sa Evertonom učestvovao u prelomu noge Andrea Gomesa. Videlo se to na obe utakmice, crveno-beli Sona ni lasom nisu mogli da uhvate i nema tu ničeg novog.

text:
Impressions from the Island: Missing Finale Stars, Ndombele Runs Show, Lo Selso Produced, Sonu Most Titles
What the English press says
07 Nov 2019 by Dejan Stankovic
The emotional moment of Hyong-min Son, who also used the first goal against the Red Star to apologize to Andre Gomes, served most of the island media as the headline detail from Tottenham's believable 4-0 win in Belgrade. However, when it comes to the very picture on the field, most of them had a dilemma when choosing the best match player: Tangi Ndombele or Giovanni Lo Selso?
Particularly enjoyable debate for the fans, as Tottenham's summer reinforcements weren't too impressive at the start of the London adventure, but at the Rajko Mitic stadium they hinted that when the line was drawn they could pay off. Even Ryan Sessenon, who only entered the match in the final round, assists Christian Eriksen for the fourth goal.
But Ndombele and Lo Selso were the stars of the evening, so the London-based Ivning Standard writes ... “It was a Spars game full of positives, but none was bigger than Ndombele, who ran the show. Lots of classy twists, touches and creations, but his best moment was seen in the construction of Son's first goal, when the Frenchman slipped between the two guards and under pressure played the perfect pass from Ali. Equally encouraging as his game was the fact that he played all 90 minutes during which he did not fade as in some previous matches, say in those 2: 7 against Bayern ... Given the price of 60,000,000 euros it is no surprise that Ndombele decent player, but tonight's game is a signal that Tottenham may build a team around him sooner or later. "
The same sheet states that everything was not ideal and it seemed that, in addition to the brand new defensive four Tottenham, she could score every time she reached the last third of the pitch, which, however, "did not happen too often". It says something about the dominance of the away team in the middle of the field.



The Guardian also notes that the Star has had some outstanding chances, but that Tottenham are simply a better quality squad. He held the ball, had 17 shots against five Stars and eventually deservedly won. Unlike the Standard, the respected Guardian writes that Lo Selso deserved the most compliments, though this first newspaper writes that the Argentine was "an island of peace in an otherwise crazy match." Lo Selsa also declared the Independent a player of the match, highlighting his goal that opened the Star. "The Betis borrowed player, who Tottenham can buy for 60,000,000 euros in the summer, previously played only 74 minutes for the Spars. After July 6th and his last game with Argentina at the Copa America, he waited for August 8th and the last day of the England transitional deadline to sign. He missed all the preparations, struggled with the save. But playing on the right showed how much he can contribute by changing the pace and the desire to pass a direct pass, "writes Guardian.
Commenting on the Stars' missed chances, the Guardian also added that the Red and White "lacked the final product."
In the end and the ratings, only two newspapers also dealt with the Belgraders and, as expected, were not too generous. The Daily Mail "glued" five of them all, the Independent also split a six. As for Tottenham, the worst went to Davinson Sanchez, best Ndombele, who also earned some "nine", after all, a logical choice, the double shooter Son, who everyone says came out of a psychic crisis after playing with Everton participated in the Andrea Gomes leg fracture. It was evident in both games, the red and white Sona could not catch their hair and there was nothing new.
